content:
Diagnosis:
Metastatic sigmoid adenocarcinoma with peritoneal and liver metastases
Initial staging T4bN2M1, NRAS Q61K and PIK3CA E542K mutations

Previous Treatment:
January 2024 - Emergency Hartmann's procedure
February-April 2024 - 4 cycles FOLFOX/Bevacizumab
May 2024 - Changed to FOLFIRI/Cetuximab due to oxaliplatin neuropathy

Current medications:
FOLFIRI/Cetuximab
Ondansetron 8mg prn
Loperamide prn
Pregabalin 75mg bd for neuropathy

Allergies:
None known

Current situation:
Pre cycle 3 FOLFIRI/Cetuximab

CT 15 June 2024 shows partial response with reduction in peritoneal disease and liver metastases

Tumor markers improving - CEA decreased from 450 to 180

I reviewed [redacted name] today prior to cycle 3 FOLFIRI/Cetuximab. The previous cycles have been well tolerated with only grade 1 diarrhea managed with loperamide. The acneiform rash is improving with topical antibiotics. His appetite has improved significantly and weight has stabilized at 72kg. Oxaliplatin-induced neuropathy is gradually improving since switching regimens.

Examination shows improving abdominal distension. Stoma is healthy and functioning well. Blood results are satisfactory for proceeding with treatment.

The plan is to continue with cycle 3 today. We will arrange CT assessment after cycle 4. Follow-up appointment in 2 weeks with blood tests. [redacted name] understands to contact us if any problems develop.
